channel.title: Ted Tschopp's AI News
channel.description: Latest AI News and Ratings from Ted Tschopp

item.title: Agentic Context Engineering: Evolving Contexts for Self-Improving Language Models [ * ]
item.description: This research paper introduces a three-part framework: generator, reflector, and curator, for improving LLMs by refining context (prompts, memories, evidence) rather than retraining models. While still theoretical, our analysts viewed it as an important early architecture for agentic systems, particularly for R&D teams exploring agent role definition, memory persistence, and team-level self-improvement in AI environments.

item.title: How Mr. Cooper assembled a "team" of AI agents to handle complex mortgage questions [ ! ]
item.description: This article outlines how Mr. Cooper deployed a system called CIERA, a multi-agent AI network designed to address complex mortgage queries, showcasing clear examples of orchestration across specialist agents. Our analysts highlighted it as a highly transferable enterprise pattern for AI leaders, emphasizing its value in visualizing and communicating agentic system design to overwhelmed executives navigating the emerging AI-first enterprise paradigm.

item.title: Introducing MAI‑Image‑1, debuting in the top 10 on LMArena [ ~ ]
item.description: While interesting from a product and branding standpoint (Microsoft’s first in-house text-to-image model, now ranking in LMArena’s top 10), our analysts considered it a data point rather than a paradigm-shifting announcement. Without full benchmarks or deployment details, it ranks lower in urgency.

item.title: Salesforce and OpenAI Partner Across Enterprise Work and Commerce [ * ]
item.description: By surfacing Salesforce’s Agentforce 360 inside ChatGPT (and Slack) and embedding frontier models, this partnership signals how workflow tools will increasingly become agent-driven interfaces. Our analysts saw it as a major signal of the direction enterprise software is heading, but debate remained about Salesforce’s execution credibility.

item.title: Kitsa transforms clinical trial site selection with Amazon Quick Automate [ * ]
item.description: This case study offers a concrete, measurable example of generative AI workflow automation in a high-stakes domain (clinical trials), citing improvements like 96 % faster data acquisition and 91 % cost savings. Our analysts considered it well-executed, though they flagged that many numbers are self‑reported and tied to AWS’s tooling.

item.title: Introducing LLM‑Evalkit: A practical framework for prompt engineering on Google Cloud [ * ]
item.description: The LLM Evalkit helps turn prompt engineering from intuition-based approaches into an instrumented, structured evaluation process, supporting better model development and deployment. Our analysts noted that this creates engineering discipline around prompts and reduces the ad hoc nature of many current evaluation practices.

item.title: The Gen AI Playbook for Organizations [ ! ]
item.description: This article frames generative AI not just as a tool but as a capability to build into an organization, with frameworks around experimentation, value-mapping, and governance. Our analysts emphasized that thinking of AI as a capability (vs. just a technology) is critical to gaining competitive advantage, making this a must-read for enterprise AI leaders.

item.title: You’ll soon be able to shop Walmart from ChatGPT [ ! ]
item.description: Walmart announced that customers will soon be able to search for and purchase items directly through ChatGPT, using a new integration powered by OpenAI. Our analysts saw this as a tectonic shift in the evolution of “AI-first shopping,” with vast implications for brands, marketplaces, and competition.

item.title: Introducing Claude Haiku 4.5 [ ~ ]
item.description: Anthropic’s Haiku 4.5 targets cost‑efficient deployment in agent settings, matching performance of larger models for certain tasks. Our analysts considered this as a routine product announcement, thereby classifying it as optional.

item.title: The Big Rethink: An agenda for thriving in the agentic age [ ~ ]
item.description: McKinsey frames a high-level leadership agenda for adopting autonomous “agentic” systems. Our analysts judged it conceptually interesting but too abstract or thin to be actionable, placing it in the optional bucket.

item.title: Inside the AI-powered assistant helping doctors work faster and better at Seattle Children’s Hospital [ * ]
item.description: In a major health system spanning 47 sites, Google Cloud’s “Pathway Assistant” is being applied to streamline clinician workflows (not decision-making), representing meaningful deployment of AI in healthcare. Our analysts acknowledged the potential impact while noting weaker quantification of business outcomes.

item.title: eSentire scales elite cybersecurity expertise with Claude in Amazon Bedrock [ * ]
item.description: This case study shows how a security firm is embedding Claude agents into Bedrock to automate incident response, delivering orchestration across multiple agents and generating incremental revenue. Our analysts found the use case compelling in the critical domain of cybersecurity even though it lacks implementation details.

item.title: Introducing Veo 3.1 and new creative capabilities in the Gemini API [ * ]
item.description: Google’s Veo 3.1 brings significant enhancements in AI video generation—adding improved prompt adherence, audio integration, object insertion/removal, and better editing controls. Our analysts agreed that this gives marketers and creatives precise control over visual style, pacing, and continuity using just a few reference images and shows how images and video can be used to elevate campaigns and engage audiences at scale.

item.title: Generative AI and Firm Productivity: Field Experiments in Online Retail [ ! ]
item.description: This paper provides rare causal, real‑world evidence that generative AI can boost firm productivity—reporting sales lifts of up to 16.3 % and an implied ~$5 incremental value per consumer. Our analysts flagged it as “absolutely essential,” noting it avoids hand‑wavy claims and instead delivers rigorous, quantitative insight.

item.title: The Art of Scaling Reinforcement Learning Compute for LLMs [ ~ ]
item.description: This research dives into power laws and cost models for reinforcement learning applied to large language models, offering predictive frameworks for compute efficiency. Our team agreed it’s technically rich and useful for engineering teams pushing frontier models, but less immediately applicable for most business AI leaders.

item.title: RTFM: A Real‑Time Frame Model [ * ]
item.description: RTFM is a new real‑time generative world model capable of rendering 3D environments on the fly with persistence using efficient compute, intended for robotics, simulation, and video/3D interaction tasks. Our analysts viewed it as a meaningful advancement in world modeling, especially given its efficiency and persistence features, though somewhat early for broad adoption.

item.title: How a Gemma model helped discover a new potential cancer therapy pathway [ * ]
item.description: A 27B‑parameter Gemma model was trained on cellular interaction and cancer and immune response data and asked to predict novel drug combinations for cancer treatment. The model suggested a novel combination of drugs that was validated in the lab and can become a promising cancer therapy path. Our team flagged this as a powerful demonstration of generative AI in scientific discovery, especially for life sciences domains, though less immediately actionable for many enterprise AI leaders.

item.title: Introducing Claude Skills [ * ]
item.description: Anthropic’s “Skills” lets organizations build modular, reusable instruction bundles for Claude, enabling domain‑specific behavior (e.g. Excel, PowerPoint automation) and closer alignment with workflows. Our analysts noted that this direction parallels what OpenAI is doing with AgentKit, and could become a central mechanism for tailoring LLM behavior within enterprises.

item.title: Microsoft launches ‘Hey Copilot’ voice assistant and autonomous agents for all Windows 11 PCs [ ! ]
item.description: Microsoft is rolling out a sweeping transformation of Windows 11, embedding native voice ("Hey Copilot"), vision, and agentic features across all PCs—not just premium ones—effectively recasting the OS around AI. Our analysts emphasized that this could be a foundational shift in human‑computer interaction, enabling voice-driven workflows and agent autonomy at scale.

item.title: We propose and test the... [ ~ ]
item.description: This research article investigates degradation of large language models over time—“brain rot”—and raises important AI ethics and AI‑security questions around continual pre‑training and model drift. However, our analysts deemed it too speculative and early‑stage for immediate strategic action by most AI leaders.

item.title: Agents 2.0: Deep Agents [ ~ ]
item.description: The piece offers a primer on agent architectures from simple agents to multi-agent with orchestrators and memory, - reflecting evolving discussion around AI agents and LLM orchestration. Our analysts appreciated the clear explanation but felt the term “deep agents” is still loosely defined and overlaps with existing “multi‑agent” concepts—making it confusing for readers and thus optional.

item.title: SWE grep [ ~ ]
item.description: This article introduces a retrieval‑optimization system for code/context using reinforcement learning which touches on AI automation and inference value engineering. Our analysts regarded it as interesting for coders but not yet broadly actionable for enterprise‑wide generative AI adoption.

item.title: Coral NPU: A full-stack platform for edge AI [ * ]
item.description: Google’s Coral NPU project presents an open‑source, RISC‑V‑based hardware/software stack for ultra‑low‑power, always‑on AI at the edge (wearables/IoT) with an aim for generative‑AI on device. Our analysts noted it is forward‑looking and more of a product announcement than tactical guidance for AI leaders focused on foundational generative AI strategy.

item.title: How Moloco is powering the future of retail media with AI vector search [ * ]
item.description: This article details how Moloco built an AI‑native retail‑media platform using vector search using Vertex AI Vector Search on Google Cloud, enabling semantic user/purchase matching and real‑time ad personalization at scale. Our analysts flagged this as significant because it demonstrates how mid‑sized retailers can leverage AI‑driven content creation and vector search to compete in retail media networks—marking movement into AI automation beyond just experimentation.

item.title: How TP ICAP transformed CRM data into real-time insights with Amazon Bedrock [ * ]
item.description: This article showcases a generative AI solution built on Bedrock that turns legacy CRM and meeting‑note archives into real‑time insights via RAG, text‑to‑SQL and large‑language‑model workflows. Our analysts emphasized that while not necessarily industry‑shifting, it is a strong enterprise use‑case of AI in finance/CRM that illustrates how AI‑driven content creation and large language models are being applied for business value.

item.title: AI Can Create More Time for Leadership [ ~ ]
item.description: This HBR article argues that generative AI can offload administrative tasks to free up executive time for leadership and coaching. Our analysts found the claims vague and unsubstantiated, describing the piece as overly reliant on soft reasoning with minimal actionable insight for AI leaders.

item.title: Plex Coffee delivers fast service and personal connections with ChatGPT Business [ ~ ]
item.description: Plex Coffee used ChatGPT Business to scale its customer interaction model and internal knowledge sharing, claiming improvements in onboarding and operations. However, our analysts regarded it a light case study — lacking metrics, depth, or technical insight — and noted its limited relevance beyond being a generic AI adoption story.

item.title: Anthropic brings Claude Code to the web [ ~ ]
item.description: Anthropic’s web-based Claude Code brings a more accessible interface to its AI-assisted coding tool, shifting it from the command line to chat-based UX. Our analysts saw this as a standard product iteration and catch-up move, with limited strategic impact beyond Anthropic’s developer user base.

item.title: DeepSeek‑OCR: Contexts Optical Compression [ ~ ]
item.description: DeepSeek’s OCR approach compresses full-document scans into vision tokens, enabling more efficient context processing for large language models by leveraging computer vision. While the compression technique shows promise for extending LLM context windows, our analysts agreed it’s an early-stage innovation not yet deployable at enterprise scale.

item.title: Developers can now add live Google Maps data to Gemini‑powered AI app outputs [ ! ]
item.description: Google has integrated real-time geospatial data from Google Maps into Gemini AI apps, allowing developers to enrich AI-powered applications with accurate, location-based intelligence. Our analysts noted this as a major differentiator and strategic move for grounding generative AI in the physical world — especially important for reducing hallucinations and improving user experience in AI-driven applications requiring accurate location data.

item.title: An Opinionated Guide to Using AI Right Now [ ! ]
item.description: Ethan Mollick’s practical guide offers a grounded roadmap for AI use, emphasizing how to choose and use top large language models effectively in real-world workflows, beyond the hype. Our analysts highlighted it as a highly accessible resource that directly answers common questions AI leaders receive, making it a foundational AI literacy piece especially valuable amid rapid tool evolution.

item.title: Claude for Life Sciences [ ! ]
item.description: Anthropic targets the life sciences sector by integrating domain-specific data and workflows into a powerful generative AI platform tailored to researchers and pharma teams. Our analysts emphasized that this verticalization trend — turning general-purpose frontier models into specialized industry AI tools — is a critical strategic signal for enterprise AI leaders across all industries.

item.title: Breaking new ground: How Balfour Beatty is using Copilot to drive productivity at scale [ ~ ]
item.description: Balfour Beatty’s adoption of Microsoft 365 Copilot across 27,000 employees has reportedly improved productivity, communication, and user confidence—especially among neurodiverse workers—according to internal surveys. While the rollout shows meaningful use of AI automation in construction, our analysts noted the case study lacked implementation depth and outcomes beyond self-reported sentiment, making it less relevant for AI leaders seeking replicable enterprise strategies.

item.title: Why Agentic AI Projects Fail—and How to Set Yours Up for Success [ ~ ]
item.description: This HBR article discusses common reasons agentic AI projects underperform and offers general strategic advice on where and how to deploy agents. Our analysts criticized it as 'thought slop' filled with platitudes and lacking in real-world deployment insights, such as API integration, security architecture, or maintenance—elements critical to enterprise-scale AI success.

item.title: Krea Realtime 14B: Real‑Time, Long‑Form AI Video Generation [ ~ ]
item.description: Krea’s Realtime 14B is a 14B-parameter autoregressive model capable of producing long-form AI-generated video with high temporal consistency using self-forcing techniques. Our analysts were impressed by the innovation but emphasized its niche use case and lack of clear enterprise applicability, calling it 'an innovation frontier story' with implications for AI in media, but not broadly actionable yet.

item.title: Introducing the new AI‑first vibe coding experience in @GoogleAIStudio [ ~ ]
item.description: Google’s new AI-first 'vibe coding' interface inside AI Studio promises a more intuitive and collaborative coding experience, built around Gemini and Notebook-style workflows. However, our analysts considered this an incremental update that offers limited differentiation compared to existing tools like GitHub Copilot or Replit, and therefore not essential to forward-thinking AI leaders.

item.title: 2025: The State of AI in Healthcare [ ! ]
item.description: This research-backed report from Menlo Ventures explores the rapid acceleration of generative AI adoption across payers, providers, and biopharma sectors—traditionally slow-moving adopters of new technology. Our analysts viewed the data as highly valuable for AI leaders, noting that if AI can drive productivity in healthcare, it signals strong potential across other regulated, high-friction industries.

item.title: Introducing ChatGPT Atlas [ ! ]
item.description: OpenAI has launched ChatGPT Atlas, a standalone, agentic browser that seamlessly integrates web browsing, search, and AI automation into a single interface. Our analysts called this a transformative step that could redefine browser usage for enterprises and individuals alike, signaling the start of a new 'browser war' era in AI-driven user experiences.

item.title: Classmethod accelerates development velocity with Claude Code [ ~ ]
item.description: This case study shows Classmethod achieving dramatic improvements in dev speed using Claude, such as 96% faster script execution. Despite impressive metrics, the group found it lacked methodological transparency and came off more as promotional material for Claude than a useful deep dive into implementation.

item.title: There is no God Tier video model [ ~ ]
item.description: The post argues that no single video model dominates across use cases and suggests specialization is the current trajectory, citing examples like Pika, Sora, and Runway. While informative as a snapshot of the state of generative video, the panel agreed its relevance is short-lived given the rapid pace of model development and saw limited strategic value for executives today.

item.title: Successful AI adoption needs workers in the loop [ ~ ]
item.description: This Financial Times article presents a mixed take on how AI adoption depends on workforce integration and quotes older statistics from UK education and Goldman Sachs. Our analysts found the article disjointed and lacking in fresh insights, critiquing it as a 'triple optional nothing burger' that fails to acknowledge the larger structural shifts and risks, such as mass layoffs and HR budget reallocations.

item.title: Gen AI in Finance Isn’t Failing—It’s Working Where It’s Built In [ * ]
item.description: Bain argues that embedded AI use cases in finance are succeeding, especially in workflow automation versus chatbot pilots. Although some of our analysts found this perspective aligned with observed ROI patterns, others viewed it as thinly veiled consulting marketing, making it more of a commercial than a strategic resource.

item.title: BOLT - How Mura wrote an in-house LLM Eval Framework [ * ]
item.description: This article discusses the creation of an internal LLM evaluation framework called BOLT by Mura, designed to measure model quality during development. Our analysts emphasized the growing importance of evaluation rigor in GenAI deployments, particularly as organizations scale from prototype to production; while the piece lacks technical depth, it introduces relevant semantic challenges that executives should begin to consider.

item.title: Unseeable prompt injections in screenshots: more vulnerabilities in Comet and other AI browsers [ * ]
item.description: This piece highlights a new class of prompt injection vulnerabilities hidden in screenshots, posing risks for AI-enhanced or agentic browsers like Comet. The team emphasized the underestimated security risks tied to AI browsers, warning that these could reach enterprise-scale repercussions due to individual behavior, making early awareness essential.

item.title: ColorAgent: Building A Robust, Personalized, and Interactive OS Agent [ ~ ]
item.description: This research paper explores an open-source agent capable of controlling OS functions through natural language. Our analysts noted the relevance of the category (OS agents), but found the paper itself too preliminary for enterprise use and marked it as optional due to limited applicability for business leaders today.

item.title: Introducing the Apps for Advertising collection [ * ]
item.description: This update from RunwayML announces a curated set of apps tailored for advertising use cases, indicating a step toward verticalized GenAI tools. While lightly discussed, its importance lies in signaling the commercialization and specialization of GenAI for the adtech sector, where use-case-specific tools are becoming more prominent.

item.title: AI tutors show their potential in interactive workplace learning [ * ]
item.description: Though framed as a PR-like piece, the article touches on the growing impact of GenAI-powered corporate training, especially for compliance-heavy sectors. Our analysts highlighted the potential of multimodal and interactive learning agents to transform workforce education and increase training engagement, upgrading it to an important despite the article's limited technical rigor.

item.title: Consensus uses GPT-5 and the Responses API to complete weeks of research in minutes [ * ]
item.description: This OpenAI case study showcases how a multi-agent system using GPT-5 dramatically compresses research timelines. Despite limited technical depth, analysts valued its demonstration of AI agents collaborating on research tasks, noting it helps demystify complex AI architectures for business leaders and supports broader industry adoption.

item.title: Human-centered AI [ * ]
item.description: This piece covers Microsoft's Copilot fall update, highlighting ecosystem-wide upgrades such as long-term memory, multi-device reach (like Samsung TVs), and an animated assistant called 'Mico.' While not groundbreaking in itself, our analysts agreed that Microsoft's scale and positioning make this evolution in AI-human interaction strategies critical for business leaders to monitor.

item.title: Why CEOs Need to Prepare for AI-Only Rivals [ ! ]
item.description: This article explores how AI-native companies will disrupt traditional businesses through superior unit economics, enabled by automation and AI-first workflows. Our analysts unanimously elevated it to 'Essential' for its timely call to action for executives, supported by real-world examples like Craigslist and internal experiences deploying AI agents, showing how AI 'employees' are already replacing major workflows.
